title: Classical Studies Abroad
description: This course features a combination of academic study and first-hand investigation of museums and ancient sites, normally in Greece and/or Italy. [Note: This is a concentrated study course (block format) normally offered in a spring term. This is a repeatable course, subject to different content; it may be completed a total of four times. This course incurs extra costs for the student above and beyond the registration fee in the form of travel, room and board, and incidental costs.]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: At least 1.5 units in CLAS and/or GRK and/or LAT

title: Great Works: Ancient and Medieval
description: A historical survey of ancient and medieval philosophy in the Western tradition.

title: Classical Mythology
description: A study of Greco-Roman mythology and legend, with special emphasis on the Olympian gods and the figure of the hero. Topics may include myths of creation, the rise of the gods, divine myths, the tales surrounding the cities of Troy, Mycenae, and Thebes and the heroes Herakles, Perseus, and Theseus.

title: Classical Studies Abroad
description: This course features a combination of academic study and firsthand investigation of museums and ancient sites, normally in Greece and/or Italy.  Students are required to give a presentation during the trip on a topic relevant to one of the sites being visited.  A piece of written work involving original research relating to some of the material investigated during the visit is also required. [Note:  This course incurs extra costs for the student above and beyond the registration fee, in the form of travel, room and board and incidental costs.]
